intro: Gratiola hyssopifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf yellowhead, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a distinct, aromatic scent. Gratiola hyssopifolia is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used by Native American tribes for various health purposes.
